subject: Self Care
title: Comparing Less, Living More
description: A short lesson to help you apply Comparing Less, Living More.

hook.text: She compared her beginning to someone else's middle. The comparison stole her joy and stopped her progress.

buildup.text: Social comparison theory says humans evaluate themselves by comparing to others. It's automatic and often toxic.

discovery.text: Upward comparison â€” comparing to those ahead â€” creates envy. Downward comparison creates temporary and fragile relief.

twist.text: The only comparison that helps is with your past self. Am I growing? That question motivates without destroying.

climax.text: When you catch yourself comparing, pause and redirect: how far have I come? That shift protects your self-compassion.

punchline.text: Compare with your past self only. That's the fair measure.

quiz.question: What is the healthiest form of comparison according to research?
options: Comparing to your own past self
